summary:
The 'Data Protection Officer' course offered by Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber is designed to prepare participants for a career as a Data Protection Officer. The course is hybrid, allowing students to choose between in-person classes at the Bar-Ilan campus in Ramat Gan or online via Zoom. The program spans 8 sessions, totaling 40 academic hours, and takes place on Sundays and Wednesdays from 17:30 to 21:30. 

The course covers a comprehensive range of topics, including: 
- Privacy laws and regulations in Israel, with an in-depth review of local legislation and sectoral rulings, as well as current compliance requirements and guidelines from the Privacy Protection Authority.
- Practical guidelines for building compliance programs to meet Israeli privacy requirements.
- A guest lecture by an experienced practitioner in privacy law enforcement in Israel.
- European privacy laws, focusing on GDPR, with material based on the CIPP/E certification by the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP).
- An overview of the U.S. legal system and privacy protection laws.

At the end of the course, students are required to create a compliance program for privacy laws and regulations in Israel, tailored to a company or organization of their choice. This project will be presented as a class presentation.

COURSE NAME: Data Protection Officer (קצין הגנת הנתונים).

COURSE OVERVIEW: This course is designed to prepare participants for a career as a Data Protection Officer. It provides a comprehensive understanding of privacy laws and regulations in Israel, Europe, and the United States, along with practical training to ensure compliance with these laws. Participants will also gain hands-on experience in creating compliance programs and presenting their work.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 22.01.2025.
- Days: Sundays and Wednesdays.
- Hours: 17:30-21:30.
- Duration: 8 sessions.
- Total Academic Hours: 40.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participants' preference.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Privacy Laws and Regulations in Israel: A comprehensive and detailed review of privacy legislation in Israel, including sectoral rulings and current requirements for compliance with privacy protection laws. This includes guidelines from the Privacy Protection Authority.
- Practical Guidelines: Transitioning from theory to practice by building a compliance program to meet Israeli requirements.
- Enforcement in Israel: A guest lecturer with extensive practical experience in enforcing privacy laws and regulations in Israel.
- Privacy Laws in Europe: In-depth study of European privacy protection laws (GDPR). The course material serves as the foundation for the CIPP/E certification by the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP).
- Privacy Laws in the United States: An overview of the legal system and privacy protection laws in the United States.
- Final Project: Creation of a comprehensive compliance program for privacy laws and regulations in Israel, tailored to a company or organization of the participant's choice. The project will be presented as a class presentation.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and register: 
  - Phone: 052-5886002.
  - Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
- Address: Bar-Ilan University, Ramat Gan.
- The program is part of the dedicated programs division of Bar-Ilan University.
